intro: Sphaeranthus gracilis, commonly known as slender globe flower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, spherical flower heads are composed of numerous tiny florets, giving it a distinctive appearance. Sphaeranthus gracilis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
